Basic Info.instruction_text:
Provide the patient's ID2 (this ID will only be used by IMS for internal
quality control).

options:
Initial pathologic diagnosis
Sample procurement
First patient visit
Basic Info.instruction_text:
Select the reference date used to calculate time intervals (e.g. days to treatment). Date of initial pathologic diagnosis is the HCMI standard and should be used unless it is unavailable. If an alternative index date is used, indicate it here and use it for all interval
calculations.

Follow-up.question_text:
Number of days from index date to date of
last contact
Follow-up.instruction_text:
Provide the number of days from the index date to the date of last
contact.

Provide the age (in days) of the patient on the index date.
Note: If the patient's age is greater than 32,872 days (90 years), please
enter 32,872.

Demographics.instruction_text:
Provide the patient's gender using the defined categories. Identification of gender is based upon self-report and may come from a form, questionnaire,
interview, etc.

Provide the patient's height, in
centimeters.

Provide the patient's weight, in
kilograms.

If the patient's height and weight are not collected, provide the
patient's body mass index (BMI).

options:
American Indian or Alaska Native
Asian
Black or African American
Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander
White
Unknown
Not reported
Demographics.instruction_text:
Provide the patient's race using the defined categories.
American Indian or Alaska Native: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment.
Asian: A person having origins in any of the peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or in the Indian subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.
Black or African American: A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.
Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander: A person having origins on any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Island.
White: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the
Middle East, or North Africa.

options:
Hispanic or Latino
Not Hispanic or Latino
Unknown
Not reported
Demographics.instruction_text:
Provide the patient's ethnicity using the defined categories.
Hispanic or Latino: A person of Mexican, Puerto Rican, Cuban, Central or South American or other Spanish culture or origin, regardless of race.
Not Hispanic or Latino: A person not meeting the definition of Hispanic or
Latino.

Provide the year of the patient's birth. If the patient was born prior
to 1928, insert the date 1928.

Medical History.instruction_text:
Has a first-degree relative of the patient been diagnosed with a cancer of the same or a different
type?

options:
Lifelong non-smoker (<100 cigarettes smoked in a lifetime)
Current smoker (includes daily and non-daily smokers)
Current reformed smoker (duration not specified)
Current reformed smoker for >15 years
Current reformed smoker for ≤15 years
Medical History.instruction_text: Indicate the patient's history of tobacco smoking as well as their current smoking status using the defined categories.

Indicate whether there was evidence of metastasis at the time
of diagnosis of the primary tumor.

options:
Ascites
Bone
Brain
Bone marrow
Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF)
CNS
Distant nodes
Liver
Medical History.instruction_text:
Indicate the site(s) of metastasis at the time of diagnosis of the primary tumor.
Note: If the anatomic site of tumor tissue is not listed, proceed to Question 16a, otherwise, skip to Question 17.

Biospecimens.question_text: Tissue sample type(s) collected for HCMI for this case
options:
Normal tissue
Primary tumor
Metastatic
Recurrent
Other tissue
Biospecimens.instruction_text: Please select all the tissue sample types submitted for HCMI with this case.

Biospecimens.question_text:
Number of NORMAL tissues biospecimens collected for HCMI for
this case
Biospecimens.instruction_text:
Please provide the number of normal tissue specimens obtained for HCMI for this case.
Note: This number is expected to be 1.

Biospecimens.question_text: Number of PRIMARY cancer tissue biospecimens collected for HCMI model development for this case
Biospecimens.instruction_text:
Please provide the number of primary tumor specimens obtained for HCMI for this case.
Note: A single primary tumor biospecimen obtained that is portioned for both sequencing and model generation counts as 1 single primary tumor specimen. This number is expected to be 1.

Biospecimens.question_text:
Number of METASTATIC/
RECURRENT cancer tissue biospecimens collected for HCMI model development for this case
Biospecimens.instruction_text:
Please provide the number of metastatic and/or recurrent cancer biospecimens collected for HCMI for this case. Note: A biospecimen obtained from a single site at a single timepoint in progression that is portioned for both sequencing and model generation counts as 1 single tumor specimen. A biospecimen obtained from another site or at a later timepoint in progression that is portioned for both sequencing and model generation counts as a second
single tumor specimen.

Consent.question_text: Number of OTHER tissue biospecimens collected for HCMI model development for this case
Consent.instruction_text:
Please provide the number of pre- malignant, non-malignant, or dysplastic tissue biospecimens collected for HCMI for this case. Note: A biospecimen obtained from a single site at a single timepoint in progression that is portioned for both sequencing and model generation counts as 1 single tumor specimen. A biospecimen obtained from another site or at a later timepoint in progression that is portioned for both sequencing and model generation counts as a
second single tumor specimen.

Consent.question_text: Total number of tissue biospecimens collected for HCMI for this case
Consent.instruction_text:
Please provide the total number of tissue biospecimens collected for HCMI for this case. Note: This number should be the sum of the normal, primary tumor, metastatic/recurrent tumor, and other biospecimen counts
above.

Please provide a number to identify which biospecimen this is in the sequence. Note: The first biospecimen should be number "1," the second
should be number "2," etc.

Please provide the CMDC sample ID for this biospecimen as it will appear on tubes and the Sample Submission Form transmitted to the
BPC.

Primary Tumor.instruction_text:
Please provide the BPC-generated ID for this sample as it will appear on the Sample Submission Form
transmitted to the BPC.

options:
Whole blood
Buccal cells
Buffy coat
Lymphocytes
Extracted DNA from blood
Extracted DNA from saliva
Extracted DNA from buccal cells
Extracted DNA from normal tissue (specify)
FFPE non-neoplastic tissue (specify)
Non-neoplastic tissue (specify)
Primary Tumor.instruction_text:
Indicate the type of normal control submitted for this case.
Note: if normal tissue or non-neoplastic tissue is selected, proceed to Question 26a, otherwise, skip to Question 27.

Provide the method used to preserve the normal tissue sample collected for molecular
characterization.

Treatment Info.instruction_text:
Provide the ICD-10 code for the primary tumor as used to generate the ID3 for this subject.
Note: If the ICD-10 code is not listed, proceed to Question 28a, otherwise,
skip to Question 29

Using the patient's pathology/laboratory report, provide the ICD-O-3 histology code of the primary tumor.
Note: If the ICD-O-3 histology code of the primary tumor is not listed, proceed to Question 29a, otherwise, skip to
Question 30.

Using the patient's pathology/laboratory report, select the primary site of the disease.
Note: If the primary site of the disease is not listed, proceed to Question 30a,
otherwise skip to Question 31.

Select the surgical pathology text description of the histological tumor type.
Note: If the histological tumor type is not listed, proceed to Question 31a,
otherwise, skip to Question 32.

options:
Anaplastic astrocytoma
Anaplastic ganglioglioma
Anaplastic oligodendroglioma
Anaplastic pleomorphic xanthoastrocytoma
Classic medulloblastoma
CNS atypical teratoid/rhabdoid tumor
CNS ganglioneuroblastoma
CNS neuroblastoma
Desmoplastic/nodular medulloblastoma
Embryonal tumor, NOS
ETMR
Indeterminate medulloblastoma
Large cell/anaplastic medulloblastoma
Lower grade glioma, NOS
Medulloblastoma with extensive nodularity
Medulloblastoma, NOS
Medulloepithelioma
Oligodendroglioma
Pilocytic astrocytoma
Other (specify)
Other1.instruction_text:
Using the patient's pathology/laboratory report, select the histological subtype of the primary tumor.
Note: If the histological subtype is not listed, proceed to Question 33a, otherwise, skip to Question 34.

Other1.question_text: Prior malignancy (of the same cancer type)
Other1.instruction_text: Indicate whether the patient has a history of prior malignancy of the same cancer type.

Indicate whether the patient has a history of prior malignancy of a
different cancer type.

options:
WHO Grade II
WHO Grade III
Other1.instruction_text:
Indicate grade of the lower grade glioma tumor according to the WHO
guidelines.

Other1.question_text:
WHO grade: diffuse midline glioma (DIPG), embryonal tumor, or
medulloblastoma
Other1.instruction_text:
Indicate grade of the diffuse midline glioma (DIPG), embryonal tumor, or medulloblastoma tumor according
to the WHO guidelines.

options:
100: Normal, no complaints
90: Able to carry out normal activity, minor signs or symptoms of disease
80: Normal activity with effort, some signs or symptoms of disease
70: Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or do active work
60: Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most of his/her needs
50: Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care
40: Disabled, requires special care
30: Severely disabled
20: Very sick, requiring hospitalization
10: Moribund, fatal processes progressing rapidly
0: Dead
Other1.instruction_text: Indicate the score from the Karnofsky Performance status scale, representing the functional capabilities of a person.

Other1.question_text:
Number of days from index date to the date initial score obtained for the Karnofsky performance status
scale
Other1.instruction_text: Provide the number of days from the index date to the date that the Karnofsky performance status assessment was performed.

Other1.question_text: Performance status score: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group
options:
0 Asymptomatic
1 Symptomatic, but fully ambulatory
2 Symptomatic, in bed less than 50% of the day
3 Symptomatic, in bed more than 50% of the day, but not bed-ridden
4 Bed-ridden
5 Dead
Not evaluated
Unknown
Other1.instruction_text: Indicate the ECOG functional performance status of the patient/participant.

Other1.question_text:
Number of days from index date to the date initial score obtained for the ECOG performance status
scale
Other1.instruction_text: Provide the number of days from the index date to the date that the ECOG performance status assessment was performed.

options:
Fanconi anemia
Gorlin syndrome
Li-Fraumeni syndrome
Lynch syndrome
Other1.instruction_text: Indicate any hereditary cancer predisposition syndromes identified in the patient.

Provide the side of the body on which the lower grade glioma first
developed.

options:
Supratentorial, frontal lobe
Supratentorial, temporal lobe
Supratentorial, parietal lobe
Supratentorial, occipital lobe
Posterior fossa, cerebellum
Posterior fossa, brain stem
Supratentorial, not otherwise specified
Other1.instruction_text: Select the anatomic location of the lower grade glioma within the brain.

options:
Cerebral cortex
Deep gray
Spinal cord
White matter
Not listed on medical record
Other1.instruction_text: Select the location of the supratentorial tumor.

Other1.question_text: Symptom related to disease that presented first
options:
Headaches
Mental status changes
Motor/movement changes
Seizures
Sensory changes
Visual changes
Unknown
Other1.instruction_text: Select the patient's/participant's first presenting symptom of disease.

Other1.question_text: Was H3 K27 mutation analysis performed?
Other1.instruction_text: Indicate whether H3 K27 mutation analysis was performed.

Other1.question_text: Was a mutation in H3 K27 identified?
Other1.instruction_text: Indicate whether H3 K27 mutation was identified.

Other1.question_text:
If H3 K27 mutation identified, in which
variant was it found?
Other1.instruction_text: Select the H3 K27 mutation identified.

Indicate the expression of H3 K27M by immunohistochemistry (IHC).
Indicate whether mutation analysis of IDH1 or IDH2 was performed.

IDH1/2 identified?

mutation was identified at testing.

IDH1 R132G
IDH1 R132L

Other1.question_text: What method was used to identify the IDH1/2 mutation?
options:

Next generation targeted sequencing
Whole exome sequencing
Not performed
Other (specify)

Question 56.

Indicate whether immunohistochemistry for IDH1
R132H was performed.

results.

options:

Evidence of MMR protein loss by IHC
MMR loss evidence hypermutation phenotype (>10mutations/Mb)
No evidence of MMR alteration

Indicate whether mutation analysis of IDH1 or IDH2 was performed.

IDH1/2 identified?

options:

options:

options:
WNT-activated
SHH-activated

Are you submitting a primary tumor tissue
sample for this case?

Other3.instruction_text:
Enter the CMDC Sample ID of the PRIMARY TUMOR TISSUE from

Other3.instruction_text:
Enter the biospecimen ordinal of the PRIMARY TUMOR TISSUE from

Other3.question_text: History of neoadjuvant treatment
options:
pharmaceutical treatment prior to resection
Yes

both radiation and pharmaceutical treatment prior to resection
Unknown
Other3.instruction_text:
Indicate whether the patient received neoadjuvant radiation or pharmaceutical treatment.
Note: Radiation therapy is addressed in Questions 94-95. Pharmaceutical therapy is addressed in Questions 87- 93.

Other3.question_text: Neoadjuvant chemotherapy type
options:
Cytotoxic chemotherapy
Immunotherapy (cellular and immune checkpoint)
Targeted therapy (small molecule inhibitors and targeted antibodies)
Not applicable
Other3.instruction_text:
Select all neoadjuvant chemotherapy types that were administered to the patient. Note: Cytotoxic chemotherapy is addressed in Questions 88-89.
Immunotherapy is addressed in Questions 90-91 Targeted therapy is addressed in Questions 92-93.

Other3.question_text: Neoadjuvant chemotherapeutic regimen
options:
Bevacizumab
Carboplatin
Carmustine
Cisplatin
Cyclophosphamide
Cytarabine
Etoposide
Hydroxyurea
Irinotecan
Other3.instruction_text:
Select all chemotherapeutics used for neoadjuvant therapy.
Note: If neoadjuvant chemotherapy was not given, skip to Question 90. If the neoadjuvant chemotherapeutic regimen is not listed, proceed to Question 88a, otherwise, skip to Question 89.

Other3.question_text:
Days to neoadjuvant chemotherapy treatment from index
date
Other3.instruction_text: Provide the number of days from index date to the date of treatment with neoadjuvant chemotherapy.

Other3.question_text: Specify immunotherapy
Other3.instruction_text:
Provide the name of the immunotherapy administered to
the patient.

Other3.question_text:
Days to immunotherapy treatment from index
date
Other3.instruction_text: Provide the number of days from the index date to the date of treatment with immunotherapy.

Other3.question_text: Specify targeted therapy
Other3.instruction_text:
Provide the name of the targeted therapy administered to the
patient.

Other3.question_text:
Days to targeted therapy treatment
from index date
Other3.instruction_text:
Provide the number of days from the index date to the date of
treatment with targeted therapy.

Other3.question_text: Radiation therapy administered type
options:
2D conventional
3D conformal
Brachytherapy HDR
Brachytherapy LDR
IMRT
Proton Beam
Other3.instruction_text:
Provide the type of radiation therapy that was administered to the patient.
Note: If radiation therapy was not administered, proceed to Question 96. If the radiation therapy is not listed, proceed to Question 94a, otherwise, skip to Question 95.

Other3.question_text:
Days to radiation treatment from index
date
Other3.instruction_text:
Provide the number of days from the index date to the date of
treatment with radiation therapy.

Other3.question_text: Are you submitting a metastatic/recurrent tumor tissue sample?
Other3.instruction_text:
A biospecimen obtained from a single site at a single timepoint in progression that is portioned for both sequencing and model generation counts as 1 single tumor specimen. A biospecimen obtained from another site or at a later timepoint in progression that is portioned for both sequencing and model generation counts as a second single tumor specimen.
Note: If yes, proceed to Question 97. If
no, proceed to Question 199.

Other3.instruction_text:
Please provide a number to identify which biospecimen this is in the sequence.
Note: The first biospecimen should be number "1", the second should be
number "2", etc.

metastasis/recurrence

options:
Biopsy
Gross total resection
Subtotal resection

Note: If the IDH1/2 mutation is not listed, proceed to Question 134a, otherwise, skip to Question 135.

Other4.question_text: What method was used to identify the mutation?
options:
Next generation targeted sequencing
Cancer hotspot panel
Whole exome sequencing
Not performed
Other (specify)
Other4.instruction_text:
Specify the method used to identify mutations.
Note: If the method of mutation identification is not listed, proceed to Question 135a, otherwise, skip to Question 136.

Indicate whether immunohistochemistry for IDH1
R132H was performed.

Indicate the expression of IDH1 R132H per immunohistochemistry
results.

options:
Evidence of MMR mutation by sequencing
Evidence of MMR protein loss by IHC
MMR loss evidence hypermutation phenotype (>10mutations/Mb)
No evidence of MMR alteration
Other4.instruction_text: Indicate the patient's Mismatch Repair (MMR) gene mutation status.

Other4.question_text: Number of days from index date to date of metastatic/ recurrent sample procurement
Other4.instruction_text:
Provide the number of days from the index date to the date of the procedure that produced the metastatic/recurrent tumor tissue
submitted for HCMI.

options:
Amplified
Not amplified
Not done
Unknown
Other4.instruction_text: Indicate the amplification status of the MYCN gene.

options:
WNT-activated
SHH-activated
Non-WNT/non-SHH activated
Not determined
Other4.instruction_text: Select the subclass of the medulloblastoma based on molecular features.

Other4.question_text: What are the markers that were used to determine WNT- or SHH- activation?
Other4.instruction_text: Specify the genetic information used to determine the medulloblastoma subclass.

Other4.question_text: Are you submitting an additional metastatic/ recurrent tumor tissue sample?
Other4.instruction_text:
A biospecimen obtained from a single site at a single timepoint in progression that is portioned for both sequencing and model generation counts as 1 single tumor specimen. A biospecimen obtained from another site or at a later timepoint in progression that is portioned for both sequencing and model generation counts as a second single tumor specimen.
Note: If yes, proceed to Question 144, otherwise, skip to Question 189.

Other5.instruction_text:
Please provide a number to identify which biospecimen this is in the sequence.
Note: The first biospecimen should be number "1", the second should be number "2", etc.

Please provide the CMDC sample ID for this biospecimen as it will appear on tubes and the Sample Submission Form transmitted to the
BPC.

Please provide the BPC-generated ID for this sample as it will appear on the Sample Submission Form
transmitted to the BPC.

Other5.question_text: Metastatic/ recurrent tumor tissue sample preservation method
Other5.instruction_text: Provide the method used to preserve the metastatic/recurrent tumor tissue sample collected for molecular characterization.

Other5.question_text: Number of days from index date to date of diagnosis of metastasis/recurrence
Other5.instruction_text: Provide the number of days from the index date to the date of diagnosis of metastatic/recurrent disease.

Other5.question_text: Method of metastatic/ recurrent cancer sample procurement
options:
Biopsy
Gross total resection
Subtotal resection
Other method (specify)
Other5.instruction_text:
Indicate the procedure performed to obtain the metastatic/recurrent tumor tissue.
Note: If the method of procurement is not listed, proceed to Question 149a, otherwise, skip to Question 150.

Other5.question_text: Number of days from index date to date of metastatic/ recurrent sample procurement
Other5.instruction_text: Provide the number of days from the index date to the date of the procedure that produced the metastatic/recurrent tumor tissue submitted for HCMI.

options:
Ascites
Bone
Bone marrow
Brain
Cerebrospinal fluid (CSF)
CNS
Distant nodes
Liver
Other5.instruction_text:
Select the site from which the metastatic/recurrent tissue used to develop the model was derived.
Note: If the metastatic/recurrent site is not listed, proceed to Question 151a, otherwise, skip to Question 152.
If the primary tumor relapsed, provide the site of relapse.

Provide the ICD-10 code for the metastatic/recurrent tumor used to generate the model submitted to
HCMI.

Provide the ICD-O-3 histology code describing the morphology of the metastatic/recurrent tumor used to generate the model submitted to
HCMI.

Other5.question_text: Maintenance and/or consolidation therapy administered prior to collection of metastatic/ recurrent tissue
Other5.instruction_text: Provide the name(s) of the maintenance and/or consolidation therapy administered to the patient prior to the collection of the metastatic/recurrent tissue used to develop the model.

Other5.question_text:
Days to start of maintenance and/or consolidation therapy
from index date
Other5.instruction_text:
Provide the number of days from the index date to the date maintenance and/or consolidation
therapy started.

Other5.question_text:
Days to last known administration date of maintenance and/or consolidation therapy
from index date
Other5.instruction_text: Provide the number of days from the index date to the last known date of maintenance and/or consolidation therapy.

Other5.question_text: Is the patient still receiving treatment?
Other5.instruction_text:
Indicate whether the patient is still undergoing maintenance and/or
consolidation therapy.

options:
No evidence of disease
Progressive disease
Stable disease
Unknown
Other5.instruction_text: Provide the disease status following maintenance and/or consolidation therapy.

options:
100: Normal, no complaints
90: Able to carry out normal activity, minor signs or symptoms of disease
80: Normal activity with effort, some signs or symptoms of disease
70: Cares for self, unable to carry on normal activity or do active work
60: Requires occasional assistance, but is able to care for most of his/her needs
50: Requires considerable assistance and frequent medical care
40: Disabled, requires special care
30: Severely disabled
20: Very sick, requiring hospitalization
10: Moribund, fatal processes progressing rapidly
0: Dead
Other5.instruction_text: Indicate the score from the Karnofsky Performance status scale, representing the functional capabilities of a person.

Other5.question_text:
Number of days from index date to the date Karnofsky score
obtained
Other5.instruction_text:
Provide the number of days from the index date to the date that the Karnofsky performance status
assessment was performed.

Other5.question_text: Performance status score: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG)
options:
0 Asymptomatic
1 Symptomatic, but fully ambulatory
2 Symptomatic, in bed less than 50% of the day
3 Symptomatic, in bed more than 50% of the day, but not bed-ridden
4 Bed-ridden
5 Dead
Not evaluated
Unknown
Other5.instruction_text: Indicate the ECOG functional performance status of the patient/participant.
Provide the side of the body on which the lower grade glioma first developed.

options:
Supratentorial, frontal lobe
Supratentorial, temporal lobe
Supratentorial, parietal lobe
Supratentorial, occipital lobe
Posterior fossa, cerebellum
Posterior fossa, brain stem
Supratentorial, not otherwise specified
Other5.instruction_text: Select the anatomic location of the lower grade glioma within the brain.

options:
Cerebral cortex
Deep gray
Spinal cord
Other5.instruction_text: Select the location of the supratentorial tumor.

Other6.question_text: Symptom related to disease that presented first
options:
Headaches
Mental status changes
Motor/movement changes
Seizures
Other6.instruction_text: Select the patient's/participant's first presenting symptom of disease.
